intro: Seddera bagshawei, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It typically grows from 30 to 60 centimeters tall and blooms during the summer months. Seddera bagshawei is adapted to survive in sandy soils and can withstand extreme temperature fluctuations.
